meanings.definition: Excessively aggressive or assertive in promoting oneself or one's ideas.
meanings.sent1: She was always so pushy, constantly interrupting others to share her opinions.
meanings.sent2: The salesperson was being pushy, trying to pressure customers into buying things they didn't need.
meanings.sent3: The pushy squirrel kept trying to steal the bird's food, thinking it was entitled to it.
meanings.sent4: Her pushy attitude bulldozed over everyone else's suggestions during the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The pushy car salesman wouldn't take no for an answer, following the customer around the lot.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a forceful or insistent manner.
meanings.sent1: He had a pushy way of speaking, always demanding attention from those around him.
meanings.sent2: The pushy boss expected employees to work overtime without question.
meanings.sent3: The pushy toddler insisted on having the biggest toy in the room, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: Her pushy behavior made it difficult for others to express their own opinions.
meanings.sent5: The pushy neighbor would often barge into conversations, making everyone uncomfortable.

meanings.definition: Tending to push or thrust forcefully.
meanings.sent1: The pushy door wouldn't stay closed, constantly swinging open with a loud creak.
meanings.sent2: The pushy waves crashed against the shore, eroding the sand over time.
meanings.sent3: The pushy wind blew the hat right off his head, sending it tumbling down the street.
meanings.sent4: The pushy child kept shoving the toy into the other's hands, wanting them to play with it.
meanings.sent5: The pushy automatic door slid open abruptly, startling the unsuspecting visitor.
